title: py-astropy@2.0.14 build error: option -j not recognized
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue
A recent addition to the package file for parallel build seems to break it for earlier versions as shown below. Once I disabled the `'-j', str(make_jobs),` build arg, v2.0.14 builds just fine. I am guessing the parallel build option must have been introduced in the later versions of the package.

```console
$ spack install py-astropy@2.0.14 ^python@2.7.16
... 
==> Installing py-astropy
==> Searching for binary cache of py-astropy
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for py-astropy found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /mnt/local/spack/var/spack/cache/py-astropy/py-astropy-2.0.14.tar.gz
==> Staging archive: /cache/sbulut/spack-stage/py-astropy-2.0.14-rbk3kevz63ex6xyknnp2qa6qxacxmaob/astropy-2.0.14.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /cache/sbulut/spack-stage/py-astropy-2.0.14-rbk3kevz63ex6xyknnp2qa6qxacxmaob
==> No patches needed for py-astropy
==> Building py-astropy [PythonPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/mnt/local/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-7.4.0/python-2.7.16-acz7a4g4lll7ombmgcoyykrjpfhc7xct/bin/python2.7' '-s' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build' '-j' '12
' '--use-system-libraries' '--use-system-erfa' '--use-system-wcslib' '--use-system-cfitsio' '--use-system-expat'

1 error found in build log:
     2    ==> [2019-10-09-21:26:07.070697] '/mnt/local/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-
          x86_64/gcc-7.4.0/python-2.7.16-acz7a4g4lll7ombmgcoyykrjpfhc7xct/bin/python2
          .7' '-s' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build' '-j' '12' '--use-system-librari
          es' '--use-system-erfa' '--use-system-wcslib' '--use-system-cfitsio' '--use
          -system-expat'
     3    usage: setup.py [global_opts] cmd1 [cmd1_opts] [cmd2 [cmd2_opts] ...]
     4       or: setup.py --help [cmd1 cmd2 ...]
     5       or: setup.py --help-commands
     6       or: setup.py cmd --help
     7    
  >> 8    error: option -j not recognized
```

### Platform and user environment

Centos 7.6
